\t\t\t\t\t\t"I HEREBY FULLY AUTHORIZE THIS APPLICATION (#31b EMERGENCY APP) TO COLLECT, STORE, ACCESS AND PROCESS MY PERSONAL DATA, THAT I WILLINGLY PROVIDED, ALL MODERATED IN ACCORDANCE TO THE DATA PRIVACY ACT OF 2012."

\t\t\t\t\t\t"AKING PINAHIHINTULUTAN ANG APLIKASYON NA ITO (#31b EMERGENCY APP) NA KOLEKTAHIN, PANGALAGAAN, GAMITIN AT I-PROSESO ANG AKING PERSONAL NA IMPORMASYON, NA AKING KUSANG PINAG KALOOB, NA NA-AAYON SA BATAS NA 'DATA PRIVACY ACT OF 2021'."

resources.string: DATA PRIVACY TERMS & CONDITIONS
#31b EMERGENCY MOBILE APP
In order to use the application or to create and register a #31b User Account, you\'ll need to agree to the Terms below.
DATA PRIVACY POLICY

#31b Emergency Communication Platform in a Mobile Application (hereinafter referred to as “the C02-DevGroup”) values and respects your right to privacy. We are committed to protect the privacy of our mobile app users. We will only collect, record, store, process, and use your personal information in accordance with the Data Privacy Act of 2012, its Implementing Rules and Regulations, in the issuance by the National Privacy Commission, and other pertinent laws.
PURPOSE OF THIS PRIVACY POLICY

This Privacy Policy informs you of updates in our corporate policies regarding the collection, use, storage, disclosure, and disposal of personal information we receive and collect from our clients/users, and any individual who communicates, raises inquiries and concerns, as well as transacts with us through our authorized corresponding communication platform. We will only use your data based on the limitations set by this policy.
TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF USE
By accessing this site, you agree to the following terms and conditions:

#31b Emergency Communication Platform in a Mobile Application (referred as “C02-DevGroup”) maintains this application to provide you with information about its services and to facilitate communication with its affiliate local authority\'s offices and health monitoring service providers.
The CO2-DevGroup requires all users of the application to adhere to the following rules and regulations:
\u25CF By accessing the application you indicate your acknowledgment and acceptance of these terms and conditions. From time to time we may revise these terms and conditions.
\u25CF The CO2-DevGroup owns the text and images, videos appearing on this application or others as indicated.
\u25CF Not all actions and information provided in the application may or will reflect on the developers that made it.

We will use our best efforts to include accurate and up to date information on the Mobile Application, but we make no warranties or representations as to the accuracy of the information. You agree that all access and use of the Application and its contents is at your own risk. By using the Site, you acknowledge that we specifically disclaim any liability for any damages arising out of or in any way connected with your access to our use of the Site.
You agree that your use of this Application shall be governed by Philippine laws and agree that venue of any relevant suit shall be located in the proper courts of the Philippines.
PERSONAL INFORMATION SECURITY

Personal Information refers to any information, whether recorded in a material form or not, from which the identity of an individual is apparent or can be reasonably and directly ascertained by the entity holding the information, or when put together with other information would directly and certainly identify an individual.

Sensitive Personal Information is any attribute of your personal information that can discriminate, qualify, or classify you such as your age, date of birth, marital status, government-issued identification numbers, account numbers, and financial information.
Privileged Information is any and all forms of information which, under the Rules of Court and other pertinent laws, constitute privileged communication.
Under the Data Privacy Act of 2012, you have the following rights:
1. Right to be informed – you may request the details as to how your personal information is being processed or have been processed;

2. Right to access – upon written request, you may demand reasonable access to your personal information, which may include the contents of your processed personal information, the manner of processing, sources where they were obtained, recipients and reason of disclosure;
3. Right to dispute – you may dispute inaccuracy or error in your personal information in the application systems through our provided contact;
4. Right to object - you may suspend, withdraw, and remove your personal information in certain further processing, upon demand;

5. Right to data ensure - based on reasonable grounds, you have the right to suspend, withdraw or order the blocking, removal or destruction of your personal data from the Application\'s filing system;
6. Right to secure data portability - you have the right to obtain your personal information in an electronic or structured format that is commonly used and allows for further use;

7. Right to be indemnified for damages - as data subject, you have every right to be indemnified for any damages sustained due to such violation of your right to privacy through inaccurate, false, unlawfully obtained or unauthorized use of your information; and
8. Right to file a complaint - you may file your complaint or any concerns with our legal compliance division: 31b.emergency@gmail.com
COLLECTION OF PERSONAL INFORMATION

We will only collect your personal information if you voluntarily submit the information to us. If you choose not to submit your personal information to us or subsequently withdraw your consent to our use of your personal information, we may not be able to adequately respond to your inquiries or avail of our application featured services.

When we receive data from our users/clients about personal data and sensitive described information, admin or other individuals, the user/client is responsible for ensuring that any such data is transferred to us in compliance with applicable data protection laws.
USE OF THE PERSONAL DATA
The purposes for which we use Personal Data are as follows:
1.To provide quick respond to inquiries and complaint reports. For this, we use admin and user service data, transactions, report forms, and device data.

2.To make our Application intuitive and easy to use. For this, we use the gathered device data. It is necessary for our legitimate interests to monitor how our application is used to help us improve the layout and information available on our emergency app and provide a better service to our users.

3.To protect the security and effective functioning of our application and information technology systems. For this, we use gathered service data, registration data, transaction data, and device data. It is necessary for our legitimate interests to monitor how our application is used, together with the monitoring of other crimes and the misuse of our application. This helps us to ensure that you can safely use our emergency mobile app.

4.To address compliance and legal obligations, such as complying with the Data Privacy Policy obligations, checking the identity of new users and to prevent identity fraud. For this, we use compliance data, admin and user service data, registration data, transaction data, and device data.
If you submit personal information for publication on our website, we will publish and otherwise use that information in accordance with the permission given to us.
We will not, without your express consent, supply your personal information to any third party for the purpose of their or any other third party’s direct usage.
SHARING OF PERSONAL DATA
We may share Personal Data with the following categories and recipients:

1. Affiliates and Service Providers: If requested and/or approved by the user or prospective user, we will share personal data with our trusted affiliate legal authorities, social services and health care service providers, in order to provide you with adequate services in relation to our assistance service and those of our affiliates and service providers.

2. Mandatory disclosures and Legal Claims: We share Personal Data in order to comply with the Applications moral and service obligations, comply with any Data Privacy Act of 2012, or other legal process, to comply with a request from regulators, governmental request or any other legally enforceable demand. We also share Personal Data to establish or protect our legal rights, property, or safety, or the rights, property, or safety of others, or to defend against legal claims.
DATA RETENTION AND DISPOSAL

We typically retain Personal Data related to application service activities for as long as you accept on-going transactions from us, and we will securely delete such data in accordance with applicable laws upon request.

For Personal Data that we collect and process for other purposes, we will typically retain such Personal Data for as long as it is necessary to fulfill the purposes outlined in the Data Privacy Policy, as well as the Terms of Use. Deletion of such data may be done at any time upon your request.
